intro: Rubus × asperidentiformis, commonly known as the rough-fruited blackberry, is a hybrid species within the Rubus genus. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically dark purple to black in color. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in woodland areas or along the edges of forests. Due to its hybrid nature, it exhibits a wide range of morphological variations.
